analysis: TypeScript reports a misspelled logger method in backend/src/lib/auth.ts at line 67: 'ersror' instead of 'error'. The logger type clearly includes error, warn, info, debug only, so this is a straightforward typo causing TS2551. The safest fix is to correct the typo. Since we don't have the exact calling chain from the error context, we provide a specific replacement for a likely pattern 'logger.ersror(' and a fallback for just 'ersror(' on the same line to ensure the typo is corrected regardless of the variable name used.

fixes.description: Fix typo in logger method call from 'ersror' to 'error' to match the logger interface.
fixes.reasoning: The error indicates a typo on a logger-like object. Most common variable name is 'logger', so correcting 'logger.ersror(' to 'logger.error(' should resolve the type error.

fixes.description: Fallback fix: if a different variable name is used (e.g., log.ersror), replace the misspelled method with 'error('.
fixes.reasoning: In case the variable isn’t named 'logger', this replacement still fixes the typo. It’s constrained to the same line to minimize unintended changes.
